actionable_issues.description: Book title appears as source instead of author in authorship relationship

examples.evidence_text: Our Biggest Deal / Aaron William Perry
examples.what_is_wrong: Book title is source, author is target - relationship is backwards

actionable_issues.description: Book titles split on commas result in incomplete fragments that are too short or end with conjunctions

examples.evidence_text: What Makes People Healthy, Happy, and Fulfilled in the Face of Current World Challenges
examples.what_is_wrong: Title split on commas, resulting in incomplete fragment 'Happy' (too short, lacks context)

should_be.target: What Makes People Healthy, Happy, and Fulfilled in the Face of Current World Challenges

examples.evidence_text: Service Leadership, Self-Care, and Global Collaboration
examples.what_is_wrong: Title split on commas into three fragments, each too short to be standalone titles

should_be.target: Service Leadership, Self-Care, and Global Collaboration

actionable_issues.description: Book dedication relationships have compound targets like 'Our Biggest Deal to Bernard Lietaer' instead of just the person's name

examples.target: Our Biggest Deal to Bernard Lietaer
examples.what_is_wrong: Target includes both book title and dedicatee name, should be just the person

recommendations.recommendation: Fix the authorship reversal logic. When AUTHORSHIP_REVERSED flag is set, actually swap source and target fields, not just set the flag. Add unit test to verify reversal occurs.

Add context-aware splitting rules: (1) Don't split if target_type is 'Book' or 'Essay', (2) Don't split if comma appears after a colon (subtitle delimiter), (3) Don't split if result would be <3 words, (4) Add whitelist of conjunction patterns that indicate single titles ('X, Y, and Z' structure)
Add dedication target cleanup: detect pattern 'Book Title to Person Name' and extract just the person name. Use regex: r'(?:.*?\s+to\s+)?(.+)$' to capture everything after 'to'.

Add instruction: 'Do NOT create is-a relationships for entity types that are already captured in the entity_type metadata. For example, if an entity is typed as Organization, do not extract (Entity, is-a, Organization).'

Make INCOMPLETE_TITLE flag actionable: (1) If too_short and part of a split, attempt to merge with adjacent fragments, (2) If standalone and too_short, mark for manual review or filter out, (3) Add confidence penalty to p_true for incomplete titles

Create a new module that runs after list_splitter to detect and merge incorrectly split titles. Logic: (1) Group consecutive relationships with same source and 'authored' predicate, (2) If targets are short fragments (<4 words each), merge them back into single title, (3) Check if merged version appears in source text

Fix SEMANTIC_INCOMPATIBILITY detection for 'is-a' relationships. Current logic incorrectly flags Organization is-a Organization as 'Person cannot be-a Organization'. Update to check actual source_type, not assumed type.
Add 'Book' and 'Essay' to protected entity types that should never be split by list_splitter. Create a whitelist of entity types immune to list splitting.
